overview: The CSS defines a responsive, accessible, and theme-aware layout for a healthcare digital experience frontend. It includes base resets, typography, layout utilities, grid systems, hero sections, banners, cards, and accessibility helpers. Design tokens are implemented via CSS custom properties for light and dark themes.
key_components: Skip link and visually-hidden accessibility utilities
interactions: Hover and focus states on links and buttons
Skip-to-content focus reveal for keyboard navigation
data_flow: CSS variables propagate theme and design tokens across components
Responsive media queries adjust layout dynamically
Focus and hover states trigger visual transitions
Dark theme overrides root variables via [data-theme='dark']
accessibility: Keyboard focus visible outlines on links and skip links
.skip-to-content for quick navigation to main content
Color contrast maintained via theme variables
analytics: Potential hooks for tracking theme toggles
test_ideas: Verify skip-to-content link appears on keyboard focus and navigates correctly
Validate responsive grid layouts at defined breakpoints
Check color and typography consistency between light and dark themes
Ensure focus outlines meet accessibility contrast requirements
Confirm navbar remains sticky and shadow transitions on scroll
Test hover and active states for links and buttons
Validate container max-width and padding adjustments across viewport sizes
